official-title.#text:
To provide uniform authority for executive departments to use funds from the disposal of Federal
			 real property and to establish a pilot program in certain agencies for the
			 use of public-private agreements to enhance the efficiency of Federal real
			 property.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
sponsor.#text: Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Property Low Hanging Fruit Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Property Low Hanging Fruit Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Uniform authority for executive departments to use funds from disposal of Federal real property

text.#text: The head of each executive department may—

retain the net proceeds of such dispositions in an account within the general fund of the United
			 States Treasury established for purposes of this section, to be used in
			 accordance with subsection (b).

For purposes of subsection (a), the net proceeds of such dispositions retained in the account of an
			 executive department pursuant to that subsection shall be available to the
			 head of the executive department, until expended and without further
			 appropriation and in compliance with other applicable provisions of law,
			 to pay any necessary and incidental costs incurred by such head in
			 connection with Federal property management activities of the executive
			 department, including acquisition, improvements, maintenance,
			 reconstruction, or construction needs. In conducting these activities, an
			 executive department may enter into agreements with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall promulgate
			 regulations to carry out this section.

In this section:

quote.#tail:
, with respect to a disposition of property or interests under this section, means the rental,
			 sales, and other sums received less the costs of the disposition.

text.#text: The term

header.#text: Plan for entering into public-Private agreements

text.#text:
The head of a covered agency shall develop and carry out a plan to enter into one or more
			 agreements with a nongovernmental person, for the purposes described in
			 paragraph (2).
The purposes of any agreement entered into under paragraph (1) shall be—

to lease Federal real properties that are underutilized or excess, under the terms of subsection
			 (c); and

to develop, rehabilitate, or renovate facilities on such leased properties for the benefit of the
			 covered agency.

A total of at least 5, and not more than 10, Federal real properties shall be leased under
			 agreements entered into under paragraph (1).
Each agreement entered into pursuant to this section—

shall have as its primary purpose the enhancement of the functional and economic efficiency of
			 Federal real property;

shall describe the consideration, duties, and responsibilities for which the United States and the
			 nongovernmental person are responsible and may provide for the alteration,
			 repair, or improvement of the real property as part or all of the
			 consideration of the nongovernmental person, notwithstanding any provision
			 of law, including
shall provide—

that the United States shall not be liable for any actions, debts, or liability of the
			 nongovernmental person; and

that no person is authorized by the agreement to execute any instrument or document creating or
			 evidencing any indebtedness unless such instrument or document
			 specifically disclaims any liability of the United States under the
			 instrument or document; and

shall provide that the leasehold interests of the United States are senior to that of any lender to
			 the nongovernmental person.

Subparagraph (F) shall not impair the ability of the nongovernmental person to pledge as collateral
			 its leasehold interest under a lease with the United States entered into
			 pursuant to the terms of subsection (c).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the head of a covered agency may lease real property under an
			 agreement under subsection (a) to the nongovernmental person that is party
			 to the agreement.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, including

A lease under this subsection may be for such period as the head of the covered agency determines
			 appropriate.

Real property leased under this subsection shall not be considered unutilized or underutilized for
			 purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and may be leased under this subsection without regard
			 to any other provision of law.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 501 of the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act/s:501

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the head of a covered agency, or his or her designee,
			 may provide services under an agreement under subsection (a) to the
			 nongovernmental person that is party to the agreement on such terms as the
			 head considers appropriate.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the head of a covered agency may retain and use any
			 revenues derived from agreements entered into under this section for
			 Federal property management activities of the covered agency, including
			 acquisition, improvements, maintenance, reconstruction, or construction
			 needs.

Revenues received by the head of a covered agency from an agreement under subsection (a) shall be
			 deposited—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 592 of title
			 40, United States Code

text.#text: in the case of any other covered agency, into the account of the agency established under
The plan of a covered agency required under subsection (a) shall—

identify the Federal real properties that the head of the covered agency proposes to make available
			 under the agreement or agreements to be entered into with one or more
			 nongovernmental persons; and
include performance measures by which the proposed project or projects will be measured.

In developing the plan required under subsection (a), the head of a covered agency shall consult
			 with the

the plan required by subsection (a) not later
			 than 12 months after the date of the enactment of this Act.

text.#text: The term
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
two reports on the
			 effectiveness of the public-private agreement pilot program under this
			 section. The first report shall be submitted not later than 5 years after
			 the date of the enactment of this section, and the second report shall be
			 submitted not later than 10 years after such date of enactment. Each
			 report shall include specific recommendations on how best to use
			 public-private agreements in all Federal agencies to improve Federal real
			 property management.
